page.title: 18Farming around Chorley (1)
page.content: One of the farms in Euxton, Toy Farm, is a Beef Cattle Farm. The bullocks are brought in when quite young. The farmer and his helpers feed them and give them bedding. As the bullocks get older they are let out to graze in some fields, but when they are nearlly fully grown bulls they are taken in before they go to the slaughter house to be killed for beef. Many of the bullocks catch diseases which mmay also spread to humans. In Toy Farm there are some stables where horses are kept. The horses graze in the field during the day and are taken inside at night.
